pros: Flexible hours, paid holidays, Monday through Friday hours, bonuses,
cons: None at the moment right now

pros: I love it so far the team work is great
cons: Busy and clients can get irate

job_title: SMI Case Manager in Peoria, AZ
pros: Wonderful training opportunities Education Financial Coverage 100% for LSMW Amazing supervision/leadership support Phenomenal BHMP/PCP Team Providers
cons: Extremely heavy workload due to high turnover rate Low pay/compensation/mileage reimbursement Poor medical benefits Personal vehicle wear and tear Personal danger risks when in the field

review_title: Great Co-Workers but Emphasized Deference to Leadership
pros: Loved the co-workers. Learned a lot from them. Middle management people I worked with were awesome.
cons: Upper management was more top-down heirarchical style than inviting of feedback from employees.

review_title: Internet access to the job application
job_title: Residential Direct Support Professional in Gilbert, AZ
pros: Excellent staff great place to work for
cons: No cons to report satisfaction

pros: Coworkers were friendly, atmosphere was laid back.
cons: There was always an air or attitude that communicated 'not my problem' or 'I don't get paid enough for this'. Don't know why, but there were some employees who opted out of teamwork. And they were aloud too! At the detriment of their team. Some of the management was either incompetent, condescending, or perhaps burned out. Caseload went well over 40 Very hard to get a raise

review_title: Good for People Just Starting Out
pros: The job provides flexibility and the pay is decent.
cons: The amount of driving required from you. Also, the fact that there is a lot of work put on you that you will never fill like you can get your to-do list done. The processes for things don't make much sense and if you are a CM you will be doing everyone's work.

pros: The only pro for this company was the members I was able to work with directly and a few of my co-workers there.
cons:
When I started—my boss stated that she was quitting. During my 8 months working there, I had 4 bosses. The leadership was inconsistent. I had two site administrators and two clinical directors while I was there. The leadership states that they care, and then nothing happens. We were understaffed the entire time I was there. The retention was the poorest I have ever seen retention in a company. I have always loved all of the leaders I worked with at previous jobs, so the entire company was a disappointment, besides the assigned members on my caseload and the coworkers I enjoyed.

I forgot to add, that we rarely got lunches since we were all so busy. We were yelled at by our direct boss constantly(even when we were doing everything we can while being understaffed). Our boss made assumptions before asking questions, and her assumptions were usually wrong, and she would at times give fake apologies. 

This was the worst company I have ever worked for. I have never written a review in my life, but I felt it necessary for this company.

job_title: Learning And Development Specialist in Mesa, AZ
pros: Its very hard to list the positives: theres pay and benefits.
cons:
Very hostile environment especially when working with the Learning and Development director. You will not get support or mentoring. There’s a lot of favoritism among the management team. 
The benefits are AWFUL. Self insured- Copa Health.
A lot of SBH- Southwest and Behavioral Health Services staff. 
Copa doesn’t stand true to their people first motto. During an HR meeting the staff were having high fives over an winning unemployment case.
Management is very unsupportive and not involved.

pros: work with patients all the time
cons: corporate business environment very formal

review_title: More a Company like than Clinical
job_title: Adult Mental Health Case Manager in Phoenix, AZ
pros: In the clinical setting you have great experience to a wide range of skill building that can promote you to other professional directions. Settings for work include: Office, In Field like Hospital or Group Home, and Clinic Setting. During peak of COVID, clinical setting reduced, depending on the month's risk levels and team success: the ability to work remote and/or remain in office as call service work to protect employee health.
cons: The company had a business mindset to complete tasked services for billing per requirements of SMI AHCCCS contract. Which poorly contributes to moral which is weakly supported or rarely generated from your immediate supervisors and higher leadership. The Burn Out is real here, especially at certain clinical site locations. The billing focused track mindset runs the employees mindset as a deadline orientation rather than a care orientation. Furthermore, as an employee, you are dispensable, there's likely little opportunity for promotions, rarely awarded small raises, and the culture is billing Over well-being; strange, for a Mental Health Clinic. Primary Company goal is to expand regionally as the largest mental health company at the Expense of what matters: healing, helping, and empowering health care management.

review_title: Hostile Work environment, not enough pay.
pros: Stepping stone for next position.
cons:
Underpaid. Overworked. Micromanaging and blame culture. Belittled by leadership. "Case managers are disposal" - Senior leadership member. 
Would not recommend, that management promotes who they like personally versus who is actually qualified and makes a good leader.

job_title: In Home Caregiver in Chandler, AZ
pros: Creating a bong with clients and seeing them grow and develop from skills.
cons: You have to find the right fit with the parent, client and yourself.

pros: Salary, hours, location, and colleagues were fine
cons: Clients were a challenge and sad

pros: Nice people, enjoyed my coworkers
cons: There is a big problem with understaffing

pros: Staff are truly committed to what they do. Gateway used to be the premier clinic and could get their again under proper leadership.
cons: Upper leadership has switched over and new leadership needs training. There is a lot of favoritism and if you don't prove 100 percent allegiance to top leadership you are ostracized. Staff are too scared to speak up as they are afraid it will get back that they said something.

pros: Diverse experience in different areas as an Office Assistant.
cons: Staff and management is not honest and does not face up to their mistakes.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Tempe, AZ
pros: Good for Students with a lot of time to study.
cons: Boring sometimes. Long hours shift. Could be stressful.

pros: They have good marketing and come across as an organization that cares.  The CEO actually does care. However, they are poorly managed and do not have systems or processes in place to set clear expectations for leaders and staff. A very reactionary environment.  Nothing proactive about management at all.
cons: Low trust, high fear environment.  Organization wide seems to all be more authoritarian and fear based rather than empowering and trusting employees. Impossible to empower clients and build their commitment because management does not have standard operating procedures in place to train employees and set expectations.  With no foundation as such, balanced or positive feedback is non existent.  Complete shame based environment by insecure management that consistently is operating in fear themselves and in turn does not listen to employees and shames them into compliance. All on my team were pretty consistent agreeing there was not enough organization to support doing their job as they though it needed to be.  This is not a strength based environment.

pros: They are flexible and pay is alright
cons: Not really much to complain of yet

pros: Working for Copa Health has been an amazing experience for me. I lived in Oregon when I interviewed for a Case Management position back in Sept of 2016. In 2017 I was promoted to a Discharge Planner then in Sept of 2019 promoted to a Clinical Coordinator. While working at Copa Health I was able to attend Grand Canyon University and received my Master degree in Professional Counseling. Copa Health was able to work with me during my internship, which was a big help. I feel that this is more like a family oriented organization than just a non-profit organization. Copa Health is not just invested in their company they are invested in their employees and the members they serve
cons: I can truly say I have no cons with this agency

pros: Don't have any positivity for Copa Health.
cons: Honestly underpaid for the amount of work and stress that a case manager handles. Behavioral health is tough as it is and without support from upper management it makes the job difficult. Caseloads are supposed to be 35 max and I was running up in the 50 as I left. Company does not care for member needs, it cares about numbers and meeting deadlines. The company does not care about employee retention and over work their good employees and run them out. I worked at Partners in Recovery/Copa Health for over three years and would not recommend anyone work there.

job_title: Hospital Discharge Planner in Mesa, AZ
pros: Pretty well organized with higher performance standards
cons: Pay is low, employee turnover is a problem

review_title: Decent pay but lack in structure/support
pros: Good pay, 4 10hr shifts, weekends and holidays off.
cons: Very difficult to pick up hours, and it is a fixed pay rate and not overtime. Poor training for computer system. Poor management. Sometimes schedule is unrealistic in job expectations as does not include time for charting.

pros:
Relaxed atmosphere most of the time
Competitive salary but don’t expect to meet productivity goals
Not always clear on management or procedural policies
cons: Belittling by CC and other CM’s is “just joking”. Things are discussed that are inappropriate for workplace and there are no clear cut training procedures on site

review_title: You have got to check out Copa Health
job_title: Digital Experience Manager in Peoria, AZ
pros: Copa Health is truly a great place to work. For eight years now I have been a part of this ever expanding company. The leadership team at Copa has allowed me many opportunities to grow professionally and I would not be where I am today without their mentorship and support.
cons: There are no cons to working for Copa. Even through the pandemic, Copa has continued to grow. There were no furloughs and staff are being given raises based on their yearly performance appraisals. The safety and well-being of both employees and those we serve is their highest priority during this time. The leadership at Copa is flexible and understanding all the while still motivating staff to do their best.

pros:
Great people with great support systems. 
Constant opportunity for learning and growth with monthly training.
cons: Emphasis placed on meeting quota.

review_title: place with opportunities to move up
pros: Thankful to have a job.
cons: Target and In N Out Burger start their employees off at higher pay rate than Copa starts peers who are required to have life experience and certifications and have to deal with highly stressful situations on a day to day basis. No incentive for peers/navigators. Its an insult.

pros:
Case management is a good entry job to get your foot in the field.
Rewarding to help the vulnerable population.
cons: Retaliation from management. Poor training. The company cares more about money than the patients and staff. IF offered a raise, the most you can earn is 3%. No overtime opportunities at all.

pros: Flexible, Salary, team environment, location.
cons: Not to much to say on this part.

pros: Work life balance was good.

job_title: Family Support Specialist in Mesa, AZ

cons: Many options to choose from when wanting to shift paths

job_title: Chief of Staff in Mesa, AZ
pros: Copa is an innovative, compassionate, accountable organization that truly cares about their members and staff.
cons: We need to find a way for daycare for our staff and provide services , consultation to public schools and law enforcement.

pros: Copa is a amazingly progressive organization. They care about the community, people they serve and they make sure their staff matters. Copa has great leadership and is innovative and is a premiere employer of choice.
cons: Mergers are tough and Copa is handling it like a world class company.

pros: Copahealth is very supportive and works hard to ensure my success as a part of the team!
cons: Needs improvement on some areas but overall no complaints

pros: Working with such a supportive management team as well as my staff.
cons: pay could be better / should be

pros: Pay, Advancement Opportunities, and Flexibility (Hours)
cons: N/A i have no cons to report

pros: Good co-workers, many of the clients are good people
cons: Their training is a joke, the supervisors play favorites, scold and embarrass others in front of other co-workers, the upper management of Arrowhead are vindictive, heartless, and driven to push services for monetary bonuses.  Case Managers are overworked and treated like they are expendable, and we were scolded if we took 'too much time' with a client who needed to be heard. Plus their entire office is one huge hippa violation.   If a company has to bait their workers to try and bring on new workers, and pay them hundreds of dollars if the employee can last 3 months, what does that tell you?  Two things:  One, they spend ZERO on retention or training for supervisors to support the people already there, and two, they are obviously poor stewards of Mercy Care's money.  RUN, don't walk, away from this disaster.  Most people do.

review_title: Thoughts about the company and people I work for and with :)
job_title: Certified Peer Support Specialist in Mesa, AZ
pros: I have been with Copa health now three years and from day one I have loved this position and the members. The support from Management is and has been excellent since starting . The amount of support, care, and compassion from the team leaders. The CEO shar has been a great supporter for the employees so that we can take care of the members while during this covid 19 pandemic. Hoa is a breath of fresh air who cares, shows empathy, concern, and praise. I would recommend this company to anyone who wants a career not just a job. I feel so grateful to be able to work from home. I feel so supported in all ways!!!!!!!
cons: At the moment pay, however Shar is working on a review system to improve the raise system. :)

pros: Greater relationships with existing staff who are full of heart and want to serve. Opportunities to learn new areas involving data and evidence based practices and skills.
cons: Two organizations that had powerful visions are now a lukewarm version. New exec leadership is top heavy, expensive and ineffective. Does not listen to people who actually know how to do the work. More interested in how they look than how the organization is doing. Sad that HR employees are told to fill out GD reviews to counter the opinions of the real people/employees.

job_title: Behavioral Health Tech in Mesa, AZ
pros:
Friendly staff. Great for entry level positions if you have no experience.  Community homes - clients take their own meds, but you have to do notes every hour. Residential homes, you just do one long note at the end of your shift. 

4 clients per home. There is some down time.
cons:
Verbally aggressive clients at times. 

Supervisors get 1st shift. Most staff works 2nd shift (2:30pm to 10:30pm). 

Low pay. No way to move up in the company unless you become the supervisor of a home (and then have to do tons of notes and coordinate with the case manager at the clinics.)

job_title: Chief Development Officer in Mesa, AZ
pros:
Great company purpose and values are represented in everything that is happening at Copa Health. 

People First, Compassion, Integrity, Perseverance, Accountability and Innovation are all at the forefront. This is especially true in Copa Health's efforts and great communication during difficult times such as the COVID-19 Pandemic.

Innovative telehealth strategies are helping Copa Health to not just survive in difficult times, but to grow.
cons: New brand is still being established. Not as well known locally, state and nationally as it should be.

review_title: Your job search ends here, welcome home
job_title: Vice President Employment & Day Services in Mesa, AZ
pros: Whether you are just starting your career or finishing it Copa Health is for you. I personally chose to start my career here and loved it so much I have stayed 35 years. What keeps me here is Copa Health's transparency, innovation, compassion, opportunities for professional growth, engaging leadership and the positive outcomes of those we serve.
cons: It is difficult to come up with cons because Copa Health is quick to address and resolve issues. Copa Health is not flawless but the key is they operate on the belief of continuous improvement.

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Mesa, AZ
pros: Supervisors care about keeping you and are supportive. It is a very easy job and clients are very easy to work with.
cons: The turnover rate is so high that they sometimes depend on relief staff that are not reliable. If no one is there to relieve you, then you are stuck at work if you work at a home where there is a 1 on 1 client. I once had to do a 16 hour shift unprepared thinking I would only do an 8 hour shift and no you can't sleep on shift since it would be considered neglect.

pros: great and caring staff, easy work non stressful working atmosphere, good job experience
cons: very low pay not enough to live on unless you have lots of extra income if the marc center paid at least minimum wage or if everything was free i would choose this job over a stressfull fast food job

pros: VERY REWARDING to work with my fellow employees and to make a difference in the lives of our Mental Health Community.
